sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"承认"之意。
means: acknowledge ：通常指公开承认某事的真实情况或自己的过错。
admit ：强调因外力或良心驱使或经判断而明确承认，多含不情愿或被迫意味。
confess ：语气较强，着重承认自己意识到的错误或罪行，含坦白忏悔的意味。
recognize ：作"承认"解时，系书面用词，主要指合法的或外交上的承认，也指公认。
concede ：指在事实与证据面前勉强或不得不承认。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"认出，识别"之意。
means: identify ： 指辨别、确定人的身份或物品的归属等。
recognize ： 指所辨认的人或物多是以前所熟悉的。
make out ： 通常指通过人的感觉器官来辨别事物。

sentence.Network_en: Why were grown-ups always so stuffy and slow to recognize good ideas?
sentence.Network_cn: 为什么成年人总是那么一本正经，对好点子反应那么迟缓呢？

sentence.Network_en: Most doctors appear to recognize homeopathy as a legitimate form of medicine.
sentence.Network_cn: 大多数医生似乎都接受顺势疗法是一种合理的医疗手段。

sentence.Network_en: He did not think she could recognize his car in the snow.
sentence.Network_cn: 他觉得她在雪天里认不出他的车子。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (earliest attested as a term in Scots law): from Old French reconniss-, stem of reconnaistre, from Latin recognoscere 'know again, recall to mind', from re- 'again' + cognoscere 'learn'

entry.def: If you recognize someone or something, you know who that person is or what that thing is.

example.ex: The receptionist recognized him at once...
example.tran: 接待员一眼就认出他了。

example.ex: He did not think she could recognize his car in the snow...
example.tran: 他觉得她在雪天里认不出他的车子。

entry.def: If someone says that they recognize something, they acknowledge that it exists or that it is true.

example.ex: Well, of course I recognize that evil exists.
example.tran: 嗯，我当然承认邪恶的存在。

entry.tran: 正式认可;承认;正式接受;赞成
entry.def: If people or organizations recognize something as valid, they officially accept it or approve of it.

example.ex: Most doctors appear to recognize homeopathy as a legitimate form of medicine...
example.tran: 大多数医生似乎都接受顺势疗法是一种合理的医疗手段。

example.ex: France is on the point of recognizing the independence of the Baltic States.
example.tran: 法国即将承认波罗的海诸国的独立。

entry.tran: 赞赏，认可（某人的所作所为）
entry.def: When people recognize the work that someone has done, they show their appreciation of it, often by giving that person an award of some kind.

example.ex: The RAF recognized him as an outstandingly able engineer...
example.tran: 英国皇家空军表彰他是一名非常能干的机械师。

example.ex: He had the insight to recognize their talents...
example.tran: 他很有眼力，慧眼识英才。

means.word_mean: 1. accept (someone) to be what is claimed or accept his power and authority;

sentences.sentence: "The Crown Prince was acknowledged as the true heir to the throne"

means.word_mean: 2. be fully aware or cognizant of

sentences.sentence: "The fleeing convicts were picked out of the darkness by the watchful prison guards"
"I can't make out the faces in this photograph"
"The Regents officially recognized the new educational institution"

means.word_mean: 7. express obligation, thanks, or gratitude for;

sentences.sentence: "We must acknowledge the kindness she showed towards us"

means.word_mean: 8. exhibit recognition for (an antigen or a substrate)

sentences.sentence: "My work is not recognized by anybody!"
"The best student was recognized by the Dean"

auth_sentence.content: Manning didn't recognize the treatment as discrimination, the man said.
auth_sentence.res_content: Manning didn't recognize the treatment as discrimination, the man said.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可辨识的, 可以审理的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cogn知道+ize……化+able可以……的→cognizable可辨识的
cogn知道+ize……化+ant表形容词→cognizant认知的
pre预先+cogn知道+ition表名词→预先知道→预知
re再+cogn知道+ize表动词→再次知道→认出来

Sentence.sentence: It was those things we all recognize when we see it, but we don't really understand what it is.
I think she's beginning to recognize that she contributes as much to our friendship, but I do
We must learn to recognize risks, because if we can't see the risks we're taking, we can't make responsible choices.
The state recognizes this in the large body of family laws that govern children' welfare, yet parents receive little help in meeting the life-changing obligations society imposes.

means.word_mean: 认出, 识别出某人[某事物]

sentences.en: I recognized Mary by her red hat.
sentences.cn: 我凭玛丽的红帽子认出了她。

means.word_mean: 承认…有效[属实]; 认可

sentences.en: We don't recognized him to be the lawful heir.
sentences.cn: 我们不承认他为合法继承人。

means.word_mean: 承认[认清](某事物); 认识到

sentences.en: He recognized that he was not qualified for a teacher.
sentences.cn: 他认识到自己没有资格担任教师。

sentences.en: He has not recognized the seriousness of the present situation.
sentences.cn: 他还没有意识到目前形势的严重。

sentences.en: The company recognized Mr Brown's outstanding work by promoting him to chief accountant.
sentences.cn: 公司提升布朗先生为总会计师以表彰他出色的工作。

sentences.en: He recognized us with a wave.

means.word_mean: [美国英语]准许(某人在会上)发言

sentences.en: If you want to speak in the meeting you should stand up and wait till the chairman recognizes you.
sentences.cn: 如果你想在会上发言，必须站起来等到主席准许才能发言。

jushi.english: He wanted to pretend that he had not recognized her.
I could hardly recognize my home town, it had changed so much.
jushi.chinese: 我几乎认不出我的家乡,它变化太大了。

jushi.english: Everybody recognized the seriousness of the situation.
jushi.chinese: 谁都看出了局势的严重性。
